meanings.definition: The quality of being very precise and demanding in requirements or standards.
meanings.sent1: Her exactingness in grading papers made her students strive for perfection.
meanings.sent2: The exactingness of the chef's standards ensured that every dish was flawless.
meanings.sent3: The exactingness of the cat in choosing its napping spot amused the family.
meanings.sent4: His exactingness in selecting the perfect gift was like a master craftsman at work.
meanings.sent5: The exactingness of the tailor's measurements left no room for error.

meanings.definition: The act of requiring great care, effort, or attention to detail.
meanings.sent1: The exactingness of the project demanded overtime from the team.
meanings.sent2: Her exactingness in following the recipe precisely led to a delicious cake.
meanings.sent3: The exactingness of the toddler in choosing bedtime stories was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The exactingness of the detective in solving the case was like a puzzle master.
meanings.sent5: The exactingness of the gardener's pruning made the garden a work of art.
